chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leta A Eckert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medication without a valid prescription.
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

BOND QUASHED

Defendant Leta A Eckert in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Leta A Eckert.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:39 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing hearing. State provides certified copy of 2nd and subsequent offenses. Record by Atty. Renner as to agreement of the parties.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.
Court adopts the agreement of the parties and imposes sentence - **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT**
Court in recess. @ 11:43 a.m.
Voir Dire List

Defendant Leta A Eckert in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Leta A Eckert.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:17 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for jury trial. Record by Atty. Renner as to review of phone dump and found no issues that would prevent trial for proceeding. Atty. Herrmann provides trial information and revised instructions as ordered by the Court. Parties are ready to proceed. Atty. Renner requests exclusion of witnesses. Court grants. Court officer may remain. Record as to stipulation regarding violation within 1000 fee of park by Atty. Renner. 
BAILIFFS - LETHA KUECKER, DAN O'CONNELL, AND JEFFREY ANDERSON
8:20 a.m. - Court off the record to seat jury. OFF THE RECORD, CLERK TAKES ATTENDANCE, SWEARS THE POTENTIAL JURORS, AND SEATS 23 IN THE BOX. 
8:35 a.m. - Court in session with same appearances. Court addresses potential jurors and reads allegations from the trial information. 
8:37 a.m. - State introduces witnesses/office employees.
8:38 a.m. - Defense introduces client/office employees.
8:39 a.m. - Voir Dire by the Court.
8:40 a.m. - Voir Dire by Atty. Herrmann
8:54 a.m. - Voir Dire by Atty. Renner
9:05 a.m. - OFF THE RECORD, Attorneys take their strikes.
9:21 a.m. - Court excuses jurors not picked, and has chosen panel sit in the box. Clerk swears the panel. Court reads introductory instructions to the panel. 
9:27 a.m. - Jury excused for break. Attorneys have no objection to the panel as chosen. Court in recess for morning break.
9:44 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Jury seated in jury box. Court reads next set of instructions to the panel.
9:46 a.m. - Opening statement by Atty. Herrmann
9:53 a.m. - Opening statement by Atty. Renner
10:00 a.m. - State calls Officer Karl Spinghor who is duly sworn by the Court and responds to direct examination of Atty. Herrmann. Exhibits #1, #2, #3, #4, marked, identified and testified to by the witness State moves Exhibits #1, #2, #3, #4,  into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received.
10:14 a.m. - Cross examination of witness by Atty. Renner.
10:23 a.m. - Witness excused. State asks for break to package exhibits and to speak to his next witness. Jury excused. Court in recess.
10:35 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Jury seated in jury box. State calls Cullen Eberhardy who is duly sworn by the Court and responds to direct examination of Atty. Herrmann. Exhibits #5, #6 marked, identified and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibit into evidence. No objection, Exhibits #5 and #6 received.
10:50 a.m. - Cross examination by Atty. Renner.
10:56 a.m. - Redirect by Atty. Herrmann.
10:58 a.m. - Re-cross by Atty. Renner
10:59 a.m. - Witness excused. State calls Officer Rami Dunaway who is duly sworn by the Court and responds to direct examination of Atty. Herrmann.
11:05 a.m. - Cross examination by Atty. Renner. Atty. Renner asks to address an issue outside the presence of the jury. 
11:07 a.m. - Jury excused. Record by Atty. Renner as to next line of questioning, and wants to know if State is going to object. Continued argument. Witness responds to questions of the Court. Witness responds to questions of Atty. Renner outside the presence of the jury. 
11:15 a.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Cross examination of witness continues by Atty. Renner.
11:18 a.m. - Witness excused. State calls Officer Brandi Nelson who is duly sworn and responds to direct examination of Atty. Herrmann. Exhibit #7, marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibit into evidence. No objection - exhibit received.
11:26 a.m. - Cross examination of witness by Atty. Renner.
11:27 a.m. - Witness excused. State rests. 
11:28 a.m. - Jury excused for lunch. Off the record, Court admonishes State to make sure exhibits are received before publishing. Record by Atty. Renner who asks the Court to do colloquy with the defendant who has decided not to testify.  Court addresses defendant who responds to Court's questions regarding testifying. Defendant is not testifying. Court addresses Atty. Renner as to discussions with her client regarding decision not to testify. Court makes finding that the Defendant's decision is made freely, knowing, voluntary, intelligent.
11:32 a.m. - Discussion as to jury instructions. Court in recess.
12:23 p.m. - Court back in session with the attorneys OFF THE RECORD. Discussion and finalization of jury instructions. Discussion as to time limits for closings.
12:27 p.m. - Court on the record. Court summarizes jury instruction discussions off the record with the attorneys. No objection by either Attorney as to final packet. Court in recess until jury is ready to come back.
12:31 p.m. - Court in session with same appearances. Jury seated in jury box. Clerk excuses 13th juror. Court reads final instructions to the panel.
12:47 p.m. - Closing argument by Atty. Herrmann
12:58 p.m. - Atty. Renner asks for side bar outside the presence of the jury. Court and attorneys discuss issue outside the presence of the jury.  Court in recess.
1:01 p.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Closing argument by Atty. Renner. State requests side bar. Attorneys approach the bench. 
1:17 p.m. - Court in recess for side bar requested by Atty. Herrmann outside the presence of the jury.
1:29 p.m. - Rebuttal argument by Atty. Herrmann
1:34 p.m. - Court reads final instructions to the panel/verdict forms. Clerk swears the Bailiffs.
1:39 p.m. - Jury excused for deliberations. No objection to the reading of the instructions. 
1:39 p.m. - Court summarizes side bar regarding rolling papers and arguments of the parties. Response/ further record by Atty. Renner as to this argument. Response/further record by ADA Herrmann as to his position/argument. Court summarizes side bar regarding his concerns that Ms. Renner was exploiting the fact that her client did not testify. Response/record by Atty. Herrmann. Response/further record by Atty. Renner as to her argument. Court summarizes final side bar regarding hand sanitizer as a prop. Response by Atty Herrmann who agrees with Court's summarization. Response/record by Atty. Renner who requests mistrial. Court denies request. 
1:45 p.m. - Record by Atty. Renner as to rebuttal argument from the State comparing himself to Atticus Finch and inference that Ms. Renner is untrustworthy, which is another cause for mistrial and appellate issue. Further argument by the Attorneys. Record by the Court as to this issue, and will readdress Atty. Renner's concerns once jury comes back to see how she wishes to proceed.
1:48 p.m. - Court in recess to await verdict. 
2:23 p.m. - Court back in session with the Attorneys/defendant for jury question. Discussion. Parties agree to answer given to the jury. Record by the Court as to agreed upon answer. Off the record.
3:05 p.m. - Court back in session with the Attorneys/defendant for jury question. Discussion. Parties agree to answer given to the jury. Record by the Court as to agreed upon answer. Off the record.
3:25 p.m. - Jury has a verdict. Jury seated in jury box. Foreperson responds to Court's questions, and verdicts given to the Court. Court reads verdicts into the record. Jury finds the defendant guilty on all counts. Clerk polls the jury.  Court thanks the jury and discharges them from jury service. Court goes off the record @ 3:28 to address any jury questions.
3:30 p.m. - Court back in session. Record by State who moves for judgment on verdicts. Response by Atty. Renner. Court will not order PSI in this matter and sets for sentencing on short turn around. 
Court in recess @ 3:34 p.m.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Leta A Eckert in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Leta A Eckert.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:32 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for jury trial. Court addresses the parties as to whether they are ready to proceed. Record by Atty. Renner as to missing phone dump that she is missing. Court addresses Atty. Herrmann as to what is on the phone. Further record and responds to further questions of the Court. Court goes off the record to discuss how to proceed. Court sets limits of 15 minutes each for openings, voir dire, and will address closings at that time. Discussion as to need for alternate juror. Court will retain one alternate. Further discussion as to playing of recordings. Discussion as to testimony as to why defendant was taken out of the car. Further discussion as to proposed jury instructions. 
9:18 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances to address enhancers on counts #2, #3 within park. Record by the Court who understands that the defense is stipulating to the enhancers. Atty. Renner responds to Court's questions that she has discussed this with her client and they are stipulating. Court addresses Ms. Eckert who agrees and does not need to speak to her attorney any further. Court accepts the stipulation.
9:20 a.m. - Record by the Court as to issue regarding why defendant was taken out of vehicle. Response by the State. Parties will stipulate that evidence can be introduced as "defendant was taken lawfully out of the vehicle". 
9:21 a.m. - Court goes off the record to address jury instructions, and Court goes through the packet provided by the State. Atty. Renner addresses the instruction for drug paraphernalia. Court instructs State to add that syringes are not considered drug paraphernalia. Further discussion as to 961.572 and definition of drug paraphernalia. Atty. Renner to prepare instruction regarding this issue. Continued discussion as to further instructions. Discussion as to edits to number #3 and #5 of verdict forms. State will edit. 
Parties have nothing for the record. Parties to appear at 8:15 a.m. tomorrow.
Court in recess @ 9:33 a.m.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Leta A Eckert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Leta A Eckert.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:02 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pre-trial. Record by Atty. Renner who confirms for trial. Response by the State that the drug results are in and the State is ready to proceed. Court addresses attorneys as to any pre-trial issues - none for either side. State to file jury instructions by noon on Monday, April 4th. Court in recess.

No Lab Reports Letter - JT12 - 04-05-22; 04-06-22

Sheriff processing fees    #22-215   $75.00

Defendant Leta A Eckert appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared in court for Leta A Eckert, Attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:38 p.m. Appearances made. Record by Atty. Renner who informs the Court that the defendant has rejected the State's offer, and requests speedy trial. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Leta A Eckert in court, in custody by video with attorney Mackenzie Renner.  Vivien L. TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
03:01 PM (64-05)  Defendant Leta A Eckert in court, in custody with attorney Mackenzie Renner.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leta A Eckert appeared by video means.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
State is requesting for a few weeks for Arraignment hearing.
Attorney Renner is objecting.

Motion Hearing to amend Bond.
Arugment by Attorney Renner, requesting signature bond or $500.00 or less for cash.
ADA Herrmann objects to the request for amended bond. Requests bond remain.
Court denies the motion to modify bond.

  Arraignment scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant Leta A Eckert in court, in custody with attorney Mackenzie Renner.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.  Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and hearing requested, within time limits. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of arrest

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR JASON D WEST.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
